info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 2 at 7:47PM PDT until June 2 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Thunderstorms are producing heavy rain across areas north and east of Las Vegas. Rainfall rates of up to 1 inch per hour have been observed. Minor flooding is expected across sensitive basins.
* WHERE...Central Clark County including Valley of Fire...Logandale and Overton Valley...and far northern Las Vegas Valley.
* WHEN...Until 1100 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 747 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, North Las Vegas, The Motor Speedway, Las Vegas Bay, Lake Las Vegas, Nellis AFB, East Las Vegas, Aliante, Fremont Street, Paradise, The Strip, Lone Mountain, Centennial Hills, Summerlin, Callville Bay Campground, Callville Bay, Valley Of Fire, Las Vegas Bay Campground, Echo Bay Campground and Echo Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
